data.title: Michigan racing highlights, results: Drag racer wins $100,000 at Martin
data.meta_description: MLive's weekly racing highlights package includes results, photos and a look ahead to next weekend.
data.text:
Nick Hastings is all smiles after winning $100,000 at U.S. 131 Motorsports Park in Martin on Saturday, July 14, 2018 (photo courtesy of Chris Simmons)

More than $200,000 was paid out in this weekend's FTI Performance Summer Shootout at U.S. 131 Motorsports Park in Martin, and it was a Ohio driver who drove off with the biggest chunk of change.

Nick Hastings of Shelby, Ohio, won $100,000 Saturday after driving his 1983 Ford Mustang to victory in the finals over Gene Hampshire of Lorain, Ohio. Hastings, the reigning NHRA Summit Super Series Sportsman champion, went 110.16 mph in 6.150 seconds.

Check out who else won big on Michigan tracks this weekend:

Lane Ledford parked his dragster in Victory Lane after winning Saturday night at U.S. 131 Motorsports Park in Martin (photo courtesy of Chris Simmons)

Honor Roll: Lane Ledford

Ledford, of Stanton, is $50,000 richer after taking top honors in this weekend's inaugural Summer Shootout at Martin Dragway. Ledford defeated Jose Diaz of Shelby, Ohio, in Friday's final to grab the cash.

Stephen McCrory of Taylorsville, Ga., also won $50,000 after beating Kevin Brannon of Boiling Springs, S.C., in Sunday's finals. McCrory went 137.91 mph in 4.8 seconds.

In addition, Kirby McLennan of Temperance won $20,000 Thursday.

Jim Froling delivered a victory to car owner Brian Pelkey Saturday night at Flat Rock Speedway on July 14, 2018 (photo courtesy of Rand Thompson)

Honor Roll: Jim Froling

Flat Rock Speedway hosted Tribute to Wayne Pelkey Night Saturday in honor of the late car owner and driver, and Froling made a great night even better.

Froling, driving for Mr. Pelkey's son, Brian Pelkey, won the 25-lap ARCA DTS Street Stock A feature race as well as a heat race. The car had been rebuilt after it was destroyed in a garage fire, and Froling, of West Bloomfield, brought it home in Victory Lane.

Froling is a successful Late Model Sportsman driver. It was his first win in this division in about 20 years.

David Mielke races around Thunderbird on July 11, 2018 (photo courtesy of Dirt XTC Images)

Honor Roll: David Mielke

Mielke, of Gladwin, took top honors in Wednesday's Summit Modified Nationals at Thunderbird Raceway, beating out Jacob Poel and Jamie Lomax. Mielke then took second to Illinois driver Mike McKinney on Thursday at I-96 Speedway.

Honor Roll: Evan Shotko

Shotko is one of Michigan's rising stock car racing stars, and he showed why Saturday night. The 15-year old Coopersville High School sophomore won the 35-lap Super Late Model feature race at the Berlin Raceway in Marne. Please click here for extended coverage.

A.J. Ward chalked up another victory at I-96 Speedway on July 13, 2018 (photo courtesy of Becky Herrington Photography)

Honor Roll: A.J. Ward

Ward, of Ionia, continues to dominate IMCA Modified racing across the state. Ward won Friday night's feature race at I-96 Speedway for his 14th win of the year. Ward collected $1,500 for the victory.

Dennis Whisman had a big weekend in Figure 8 competition (photo courtesy of Rand Thompson)

Honor Roll: Dennis Whisman Sr.

Whisman, of Brownstown Township, won Friday night at Toledo Speedway and Saturday at Flat Rock Speedway in ARCA Figure 8 competition. Whisman is a five-time track champion, and Saturday's win was his 56th at Flat Rock.

Billy Moyer won the July 11 Hell Tour race at Thunderbird Raceway in Muskegon (photo courtesy of Dirt XTC Images)

Hell Tour at Thunderbird

The DIRTcar Summer Nationals Late Model Hell Tour arrived in Michigan last week for a doubleheader at Thunderbird Raceway in Muskegon and I-96 Speedway in Lake Odessa.

Billy Moyer Sr. of Batesville, Ark., won Wednesday's race at Thunderbird. Moyer, 60, captured the 40-lap race and became the circuit's first driver to record 100 wins.

Jason Feger raced to victory in Thursday's Hell Tour race at I-96 Speedway in Lake Odessa (photo courtesy of Becky Herrington Photography)

Hell Tour at I-96 Speedway

Jason Feger of Bloomington, Ill., passed Billy Moyer Sr. for the lead on lap 36 and held on to record his first DIRTcar Summer Nationals Hell Tour win of the season in Thursday night's 40-lap Dan Salay Memorial at I-96 Speedway.

The Hell Tour wrapped up Friday and Saturday at Oakshade Raceway. Brian Shirley won the 2018 title.

Berlin Raceway's defending Super Late Model track champion will be competing in Saturday's ARCA race at the Marne half-mile (photo courtesy of ARCA)

Up Next: Primera Plastics 200

The ARCA Series will return to Berlin Raceway Saturday after a one-year hiatus. This marks the 30th ARCA race at the Marne half-mile dating back to 1958.

Eric Spangler of Lake City won his fourth Late Model feature race of the season Saturday, July 14, 2018 at Merritt Speedway (photo courtesy of Randy Ellen)

Up Next: 30th annual Ed VanDuinen Wood Tic Weekend presented by Diesel Freak

Merritt Speedway is hosting one of the state's marquee events each summer. The doubleheader weekend will run Friday and Saturday, and it will feature all eight regular divisions competing for huge payouts. The show will be headlined by the $4,000 to win Soaring Eagle UMP DIRTcar Late Models, and the $2,000 to win Cadillac Tire Center UMP DIRTcar Modifeds.

Friday will feature the heat races for each division, plus the special dash for cash events. All the A-Mains will run Saturday. Pit gates will open at 2:00 p.m. both days with the racing action is scheduled to start at 7:00 p.m.

Driver Stan Yee Jr. stands under a picture of his dad, the late Stan Yee Sr. It was taken in Stan Jr.'s trailer earlier this year (photo courtesy of Rand Thompson)

Up Next: Stan Yee Memorial 150

Flat Rock Speedway is hosting the Stan Yee Memorial Saturday. It is the 11th running of the race, which honors Mr. Yee, who passed away in 2007. Mr. Yee was a longtime car owner, and his yellow No. 33 competed in races all over the country.

A field of 25 Late Models is expected for this ARCA Gold Cup Outlaw Late Model event, the longest race this season at Flat Rock.

Previous winners include Justin Schroeder, Mike Root, Phil Bozell, Mike Luberda, Dakota Carlson, Jeff Ganus, Harold Fair Jr, Eric Lee, and last year's winner Jimmy Thiel.

Up Next: World Series of Compact Racing

The 2018 World Series of Compact Racing is billed as the largest fund purse ever in Michigan for this class of racing, and it's coming to Kalamazoo Speedway Friday and Berlin Raceway Saturday. Friday's winner will collect $2,000 and $1,500 on Saturday.

(photo courtesy of Jason Pictures)

Scary moment

Springport driver John Gearhart had quite the scare when his Late Model caught fire. A broken oil line triggered the fire. Gearhart escaped injury.

Dillon Holtzlander's team does some final work on his Sportsman prior to Saturday's first feature race at Berlin Raceway on July 14, 2018 (Steve Kaminski | skaminsk@mlive.com)
